description.narrative: The Project includes: (i) procurement of about 64 modern large capacity Euro-5 diesel buses and the bus workshop tools and equipment; (ii) reconstruction of the depot with maintenance and repair workshops and (iii) expansion of the traffic planning and management system of the dispatch center.

Users access and service reliability: Renewal and significant increase of the City's municipal bus fleet with modern, efficient, safe and environmentally friendly large capacity units. The Project will increase ridership capacity, which will help MTTU serve growing demand for public transport (including pensioners and veterans), and ensure reliability of bus services. 2. Bus service quality: Service standards will be improved in 62% of MTTU expanded fleet which will enable the provision of comfortable, efficient, and safe bus services. 3. Environment: Environmental benefits will include a reduction in CO2 emissions due to the replacement of outdated fleet and improved fleet utilization. 4. Resilience: The Project, along with advisory services, will promote systemic modification to pricing of bus transport service enabling cost recovery and promoting financial viability of public service. The Project is going to set incentives to improve the declining quality of private bus operators service. 5. Sustainability: The Project will enable systemic changes in 35% of Mariupol's municipal transport service by fostering the adoption of European environmental standards, such as fleet compliance with Euro 5 diesel, and with potential for replication to private service operators.
